conclusion: Principles of shadow formation depend on position and distance of light source relative to object and surface.
Light source casts shadows A, B, C, and D from objects onto the ground.
Moving the light source backward changes the angle of light relative to objects and ground.
Shadows become longer and more elongated as light source moves backward.
Shadows will stretch out more, increasing in length.
Position of shadows will shift closer to the objects as light source moves backward.
Shadows will appear to move toward the objects.
Shadow A will become longer and move closer to the birdcage.
Shadow B will become longer and move closer to the box.
Shadow C will become longer and move closer to the cone.
Shadow D will become longer and move closer to the cross.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become longer and move closer to their respective objects.
